description: Japan is home to the world's busiest pedestrian crossing, the Shibuya Crossing, where thousands cross at once.
Brazil has the largest rainforest in the world, the Amazon, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined, with over 3 million lakes.
Australia is home to the world's longest fence, the Dingo Fence, stretching over 5,600 km.
India is the world's largest democracy and has over 2,000 spoken languages.
China's Great Wall is the longest structure ever built, stretching over 21,000 km.
Russia is the largest country by land area, covering 11 time zones.
The U.S. has the world's largest economy and the most billionaires of any country.
France is the most visited country in the world, with over 90 million tourists annually.
Germany is home to the world's first highway, the Autobahn, which has sections with no speed limit.
Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage sites, including the Colosseum and Venice.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (executive), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
Mexico City is sinking about 50 cm per year due to groundwater extraction.
Argentina is home to the widest avenue in the world, Avenida 9 de Julio, with 12 lanes.
Saudi Arabia is the only country in the world without a single natural river.
Indonesia is the world's largest island country, with over 17,000 islands.
South Korea has the fastest internet speeds in the world.
Spain is home to the world's oldest restaurant, Restaurante Botín, founded in 1725.
